Detailed Description

represents a DRAM system, the memory controller(s) and associated channels

contains a representation for a DRAM system, with the memory controller(s), channels, ranks, banks statistics, ability to read input streams, handle asynchronous requests, return requests at certain times

Author:
Joe Gross

transaction * dramSystem::getNextIncomingTransaction (  )  [protected]

get the next logical transaction

Author:
Joe Gross
Returns:
the next transaction, NULL if there are no more available transactions

transaction * dramSystem::getNextRandomRequest (  )  [protected]

get a random request

create a random transaction according to the parameters in systemConfig use the probabilities specified to generate a mapped request

Author:
Joe Gross
Returns:
a pointer to the transaction that was generated

bool dramSystem::convertAddress ( addresses &  thisAddress  )  const [protected]

converts a given memory request from a physical address to a rank/bank/row/column representation

converts according to the address mapping scheme in systemConfig

Author:
Joe Gross
Parameters:
thisAddress the addresses representation to be decoded in-place
Returns:
true if the conversion was successful, false if there was some problem

const void * dramSystem::moveAllChannelsToTime ( const tick_t  endTime,
tick_t *  transFinishTime 
)

moves all channels to the specified time

if a transaction completes before the end time is reached, it is returned and transFinishTime variable is set

Author:
Joe Gross
Parameters:
endTime the time which the channels should be moved to, assuming no transactions finish
transFinishTime the time at which the transaction finished, less than the endTime
Returns:
a transaction which finished somewhere before the end time

bool dramSystem::enqueue ( transaction *  currentTransaction  ) 

enqueue the transaction

attempts to enqueue the transaction in the correct channel also sets the enqueue time to the current time

Author:
Joe Gross
Parameters:
currentTransaction the transaction to be added to the per-channel queues
Returns:
true if the transaction was able to be enqueued

tick_t dramSystem::nextTick (  )  const [virtual]

returns the time at which the next event happens

returns the time when the memory system next has an event
the event may either be a conversion of a transaction into commands or it may be the the next time a command may be issued

Author:
Joe Gross
Returns:
the time of the next event, or TICK_T_MAX if there was no next event found

Author:

void dramSystem::runSimulations3 (  ) 

automatically runs the simulations according to the set parameters

runs either until the trace file runs out or the request count reaches zero
will print power and general stats at regular intervals
pulls data from either a trace file or generates random requests according to parameters

Author:
Joe Gross
